title: [Large-scale] Exploring Observational Learning Psychological Mechanisms in Online Retail Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of psychology and consumer behavior theory, observational learning concepts, and experience in project-based learning
context.additional_context: Course for math educators to learn research methodologies analyzing consumers' psychological distance and observational learning types in online retail environments, emphasizing experimental design and data analysis competencies using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can implement experimental designs that distinguish consumer observational learning types (appropriate/inappropriate) based on psychological distance.
Learners can mathematically model the interaction effects of product popularity and appeal in online retail environments.
Learners can analyze consumer decision-making processes by applying Construal Level Theory.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
